DOC.brief_summary: The study objective is to improve morbidity and mortality of high-risk critically ill children. Our hypothesis is that a strict ICU glucose control protocol will decrease morbidity and mortality associated with hyperglycemia in a population of high-risk critically ill pediatric patients.
DOC.brief_title: Strict Glucose Control of Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Patients
DOC.criteria: Vasoactive infusion (e.g. dopamine, epinephrine, norepinephrine) and/or Invasive mechanical ventilation Age between 1 mo and 21 yrs Type I diabetes mellitus Have an illness that requires insulin daily Recipients of solid organ transplants Participation in an experimental trial that might affect outcome Postoperative patients with planned extubation upon recovery Patients on a dopamine infusion of less than 3 mcg/kg/minute
